episode.title: International Primate Protection League v. Administrators, Tulane Educational Fund

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Chief Justice Rehnquist
turn.text: The opinions of the Court in two cases will be announced by Justice Marshall.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: The first case, No. 90-89, International Primate Protection League versus the Administrators of Tulane Education Fund, is here on writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit.
The question before us today is whether federal agencies can remove the suit to Federal District Court pursuant to Section 1142 of Title 28 of the U. S. Code.
In an opinion filed with the Clerk today, we reverse the decision of the Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit and remand the case to the State Court.
Justice Scalia took no part with the decision of this case.
